proof.para: Using the inverse function p\from (\StDffrnc{\RNr}{0})\to (\StDffrnc{ \RNr }{ 0 }), we express the function (f/g) as a composite of functions as follows:

li.para: (1/g) = p\Comp g, which is continuous at x, as g is continuous at x and p is continuous at g(x).
Thus f\cdot (1/g) is continuous at x, as both functions f and (1/g) are continuous at x.
